raw_text:
Kirwan demands Italy consistency
 
 Italy coach John Kirwan has challenged his side to match the performance they produced in pushing Ireland close when they meet Wales on Saturday.
 
 Despite losing 28-17 in Sunday's Six Nations encounter, the Italians confirmed their continuing improvement. "Our goal is to match every side we face and against Ireland we showed we could do that," said Kirwan. "But the most important thing is that we build on that performance when we play Wales on Saturday." Italy's half-backs had a mixed afternoon, with recalled scrum-half Alessandro Troncon impressing but fly-half Luciano Orquera having an off-day with the boot. Kirwan said: "I was very happy with Troncon. He had an incredible game - he was very good in attack and defence. "Orquera's kicking was off but he showed great courage in defence. "He also followed the game plan. We have to give him confidence because he has the capability to do well."
llama3.2:1b: Italy coach John Kirwan demands consistency from his team, despite their loss to Ireland. He praised the performance of half-back Alessandro Troncon but criticized fly-half Luciano Orquera's kicking and defense.
llama3.2:3b: Italy coach John Kirwan demands consistency from his team, citing their improvement as they look to match every side they face, including Wales on Saturday.
gemma2:2b: Italy coach Kirwan wants his team to build on their performance against Ireland, where they were close despite losing 28-17. He praised scrum-half Alessandro Troncon's performance and said fly-half Luciano Orquera had a mixed game but showed courage in defense.  The key is for the team to take that momentum into the Wales match.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Italy coach John Kirwan is concerned that his team will not be able to match Ireland's consistent performance when they face Wales on Saturday. However, Italy's half-backs had an impressive game in Sunday's Six Nations match against Ireland and are expected to continue improving their ability against Wales. The Italian coach stated that building on their recent success can only be achieved by playing well against the Welsh team.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Italy coach John Kirwan demands their performance matches that against Ireland, emphasizing continued improvement despite losing 28-17. Half-backs' performances mixed; Troncon impresses while Orquera struggles with kicking. Building on this performance is crucial for Italy's upcoming match against Wales.
qwen2.5:3b: Italy coach John Kirwan demands his team replicate their performance against Ireland, where they pushed the favored side 28-17, when facing Wales on Saturday. Despite losing to Ireland, Italy demonstrated improvement and is focused on building from that game. Half-backs Alessandro Troncon was praised for an impressive performance, while Luciano Orquera had a poor kicking day but showed courage in defense. Kirwan expressed confidence in Orquera's ability to improve.

smollm:1.7b: Italy needs to match every side they face, against Ireland they show they could do that and build on that performance when they play Wales on Saturday.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, I need to summarize this text concisely. Let me read through it carefully.

The text is about a match between Italy and Wales on Saturday. The focus is on John Kirwan from the Italian coach challenging his team to match their performance against Ireland last week.

In the previous game against Ireland, Italy scored 28 points and conceded 17, which showed their improvement. Now they're facing Wales, expecting a similar or better result.

The summary needs to capture the key points: Kirwan's challenge, the team's recent success, the half-backs' performance (Alessandro Troncon is doing well, Luciano Orquera has an off day), and the coach's comments about their efforts.
</think>

Italy's coach John Kirwan challenges his side to match their 28-17 win against Ireland. The team is expected to face Wales on Saturday with a focus on improving performance. Half-backs Alessandro Troncon (excellent) and Luciano Orquera (off day, good work in defense).
tinyllama:1.1b: Kirwan warns of Italy's consistency during upcoming clash against Wales, while emphasizing that despite losing to Ireland by just a few points, they have shown improvement throughout their matches. He believes that Italian forward play is solid, with half-back options like Troncón and Orquerá providing good attacking options, and that the team has to give the player adequate confidence for them to perform well.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Kirwan demands Italy consistency; Italy coach John Kirwan challenges his side to maintain their performance level against Ireland and Wales. Despite losing a close match against Ireland, Italy's improvement is apparent. Troncon and Orquera were both impressive, with the latter showing great courage in defense. Kirwan praised both players for contributing greatly to Italy's performance, particularly Troncon who showed great skill in attack and defence. The coach emphasized that his team must maintain this level of consistency against opposing teams to have a successful season.
phi:2.7b: Italy coach John Kirwan challenged his side to match their performance of pushing Ireland close during their Six Nations encounter, despite losing 28-17, and they confirmed their improving abilities. They hoped to build on that performance when playing Wales on Saturday. While Italian half-backs had a mixed afternoon with Troncon impressing, Orquera having an off-day, and Kirwan was happy with Troncon's performance.
orca-mini:3b: John Kirwan wants Italy to match their performance against Ireland in the Six Nations, despite losing 28-17. The Italian halfbacks impressed in attack and defense, with Troncon standing out. However, Orquera had an off day with his kicking. Kirwan praised Troncon for his game, while also commending Orquera's courage in defense.

Italy (rallying after close match) (coach demanding consistency)

stablelm-zephyr:3b: Italy's coach, John Kirwan, praised the team's improvement and challenged them to replicate their performance against Ireland in the upcoming match against Wales. Despite a 28-17 loss to Ireland, Kirwan highlighted the positive aspects of the team's play, particularly the impressive display by recalled scrum-half Alessandro Troncon. He also acknowledged fly-half Luciano Orquera's courageous defense but mentioned that his kicking was off. Overall, Kirwan emphasized the need for building upon the previous performance and giving Orquera confidence to perform better.

Despite the 28-17 defeat, Italy demonstrated progress, and Kirwan emphasized the need to build on that display. He praised scrum-half Alessandro Troncon for his strong performance in both attack and defense, while acknowledging fly-half Luciano Orquera's struggles with kicking but commending his defensive effort and adherence to the game plan. Kirwan stressed the importance of giving Orquera confidence to improve.

The halfbacks had mixed performances, with Troncon excelling in both attack and defense but Orquera struggling with the boot. Although Orquera's kicking was subpar, Troncon's performance was commended for his versatility and effectiveness in both attack and defense. Kirwan emphasizes building upon this display to secure a better outcome against Wales.
